EUROPHYSICS LETTERS
15 October 1997
Europhys. Lett., 40 (2), pp. 171-175 (1997)
Strong spin-dependent electron correlation effects
in photoemission from itinerant magnets
H. A. Dürr 1 , G. van der Laan 1 , D. Spanke 2
F. U. Hillebrecht 2 and N. B. Brookes 3
1 Synchrotron Radiation Source, Daresbury Laboratory
-Warrington WA4 4AD, UK
2 Institut für Angewandte Physik, Heinrich-Heine-Universität
40225 Düsseldorf, Germany
3 European Synchrotron Radiation Facility
-BP 220, F-38043 Grenoble, France
( received 19 June 1997; accepted in final form 9 September 1997 )
PACS. 71.70−d -Level splitting and interactions.
PACS. 75.25+z -Spin arrangements in magnetically ordered materials (including neutron and
spin-polarized electron studies, synchrotron-source X-ray scattering, etc.).
PACS. 78.20Ls -Magnetooptical effects.
Abstract. -
The Fe 2p photoemission of ferromagnetic iron shows a dichroism which indicates
a strong difference in hybridization for spin-up and spin-down electrons. In contrast, the
dichroism of the localized Mn surface alloys reveals intense unscreened satellite structure. The
spin polarization of the core hole is quantified using the dichroism in the Fe L3M2,3M2,3 Auger
spectrum measured with the light helicity vector perpendicular to the magnetization direction.
The observations in the 3d metals are in strong contradiction with the expectations from an
independent-particle model.
